title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 12, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Citrus & Salt opens a second location in Burlington offering colorful decor, tacos, and an expansive patio, debuting Summer 2026.
Moro Mou blends Greek and Japanese cuisines in a 15-seat omakase setting, opening in Boston Seaport in Summer 2026.
The Down Low brings a cocktail supper club with live entertainment and Detroit-style pizza to Woburn, now open since January 2026.

title: Nikola Vucevic, Celtics roll into All-Star break with blowout win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic scored 19 points and led the Celtics to a 124-105 victory over the Chicago Bulls.
Vucevic showed improved comfort and versatility on the court, contributing significantly off the bench.
Payton Pritchard and Jordan Walsh also performed well, helping the Celtics reach the All-Star break on a high note.

title: ‘Modern day concentration camp’: Irish man living in Boston area has been in ICE detention for 5 months
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Seamus Culleton, an Irish man in the Boston area, has been in ICE detention for five months after overstaying a visa.
Culleton described his detention at the ERO East Montana ICE Camp in El Paso as having poor hygiene and limited sunlight.
The Department of Homeland Security claims Culleton received due process and rejected accusations of inadequate detention conditions.

title: Will Patriots move on from Stefon Diggs? Maye says WR has a lot ‘left in the tank’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs could be cut by Patriots to save up to $20.8 million in salary cap space.
Drake Maye praises Diggs' contributions, expressing hope to continue their collaboration despite offseason uncertainties.
Diggs faces legal issues, including a court date for assault charges and a lawsuit in Florida from a former associate.

title: Watch: Maynard police, fire crews save dog from ‘pet owner’s worst nightmare’
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Maynard fire and police rescued a dog that fell through ice on Mill Pond just after 9 p.m. Tuesday.
Firefighters, guided by a police drone, completed the rescue in under ten minutes without serious incident.
The dog, Rufus, returned home uninjured after the rescue, with officials confident of a full recovery.

title: Signal issues cause multiple delays and cancellations on at least 6 commuter rail lines
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Signal issues caused delays up to 50 minutes across all 12 commuter rail lines on Wednesday.
Over 25 trains were canceled due to signal problems, affecting multiple commuter rail lines throughout the day.
Blue Line experienced a power issue causing service shutdown between Orient Heights and Wonderland, resolved by evening.

title: Former Worcester councilor found guilty of assault on police officer related to ICE arrest
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Etel Haxhiaj, ex-Worcester councilor, found guilty of assaulting a police officer during an ICE-related incident.
Haxhiaj sentenced to six months probation and 40 hours community service, acquitted of interfering with an officer.
Incident occurred during ICE arrest of Rosane Ferreira de Oliveira; Haxhiaj was accused of shoving Officer Shauna McGuirk.

title: JetBlue lounge at Logan Airport will make its debut this summer
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: JetBlue will open its BlueHouse BOS lounge at Logan Airport's Terminal C near gate C23 this summer.
The Boston lounge will be 11,000 square feet, nearly 40% larger than the New York JFK lounge.
Amenities will include complimentary food, beverages, a full-service bar, and private workspaces with free WiFi.

title: ESPN predicts Patriots will target offensive lineman with 1st-round pick in 2026 NFL Draft
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots likely to target offensive tackle Caleb Lomu from Utah with 31st pick in 2026 NFL Draft.
New England's O-line struggled in Super Bowl LX, highlighting need for depth and development.
Coach Mike Vrabel affirms commitment to current left tackle Will Campbell despite postseason criticism.

title: New Red Sox Caleb Durbin models his game after former Boston MVP
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Caleb Durbin, a recent acquisition by the Boston Red Sox, models his game after former MVP Dustin Pedroia.
Durbin finished third in NL Rookie of the Year voting in 2025 and is expected to strengthen Boston's infield.
Traded from the Brewers, Durbin aims to enhance his batting power at Fenway despite limited home runs last season.
